justification: Methods: "A longitudinal preferential choice experiment paradigm was used (figure 1)" to test for classic preference reversals such as the attraction effect, indicating this paradigm served as the measurement procedure.

measured_by: participant betting task on simulated horse races
justification: Experiment 1b: "the participants entered their preference in the form of bets on each of the horses involved in the choice set," showing that the betting task operationalised and measured the attraction effect.

measured_by: benchmark comparison task with preference points
justification: Experiment 2 states that after each set of computer benchmark tests "participants were asked for their preference in form of preference points", which is how the compromise effect was quantified.
